HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!The shakiness can be due to high or low BP, or due to low or high blood sugar or due to hormonal imbalance.You need to get examined to rule out a few things such as low blood pressure, postural hypotension (fall in blood pressure, cervical spinal nerve compression, hypoglycemia (low blood sugar), severe anemia, an underactive thyroid (called hypothyroidism), overactive thyroid (called hyperthyroidism), adrenal insufficiency (called Addison's disease), GERD or gastric reflux, and internal ear infections.Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

Magnesium deficiency symptoms include feeling off balance; tremors; muscle weakness; is essential to balance blood sugar - deficiency is strongly linked to hypoglycemia, insulin resistance, pre diabetes and diabetes; a common deficiency symptom with a thyroid imbalance (notably hypothyroidism); causes high blood pressure.Magnesium Deficiency = Higher Risk for Diabetes Mellitus? New Study Confirms Link >>>http://www.drmortonwalker.com/2011/04/magnesium-deficiency-higher-risk-for-diabetes-mellitus-new-study-confirms-link/
